article.headline: Portland 76, UC Davis 72
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Sherrard Watson scored 21 points and Ben Sullivan had 16 points and 10 rebounds to lead Portland to a 76-72 win over UC Davis on Sunday. Jamie Jones added 13 points and 10 rebounds for the Pilots, who won their second game of the weekend after starting the season with three defeats. Jones and Sullivan combined for 20 points in the final 10 minutes, including 16 straight during a stretch that saw the Pilots turn a two-point deficit into a 65-57 lead. Vince Oliver and David Carter had 12 points apiece for the Aggies (0-4), who closed to within 72-68 on Bussey Ellis' 3-pointer with 33 seconds left. After Portland's Walter Thompson made a free throw, Oliver hit a driving layup to trim the lead to 73-70. The Aggies, however, would get no closer. The Pilots shot 52 percent from the field and outrebounded the Aggies 39-30. The teams combined for 45 turnovers and both converted less than 60 percent of their free throws.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
